subject: Dear Friend
body:
Dear Friend
I am very sorry for the informal manner in which this letter is reaching you, as this was necessitated by my urgent need to reach you.I therefore mail on a positive note anticipating your kind consideration, and plead for your time and understanding in this.First, my name is Mrs. Janet Kumah. I am the wife of late Mr. Kwesi Micheal Kumah, who was a very successful business tycoon based here in Ghana.He was the Chairman Executive Officer of LA-PALM ROYAL BEACH HOTEL,C.E.O. KUMAT HOLDINGS and a host of other companies died last month at the age of 48 years after a brief-illness at the Kolebu Teaching Hospital here in Ghana.
In our world today, such a manner of approach may not be acceptable or very suspicious, as we do not know each other well and have not had any sort of communication in the past, but I urge you to take my message very serious, considering the situation.Could you believe that the tradition and customs of the town and village where my late husband came from demands that any woman who does not have a male child for the husband, that whenever the husband dies, all the properties belonging to the late husband including cash will be shared among the late husband relatives and the woman will be sent out of the husband's house for good? My dear, this is exactly what I am going through right now since last month my husband died.His brothers had taken all the properties belonging to my late husband including Companies, Bank accounts and as well sent me and my little daughters out of his house just because I did not have a male child
for him.
This is a wicked tradition and culture that has no moral value. As I am talking to you now, I and my two daughters are going through hell at
the moment. But as God may have it, I'm having in my possession all the vital documents in relation to the deposited fund of the sum of
$4.2 Million U.S Dollars - (FOUR MILLION, TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND U.S DOLLARS ONLY), he deposited in a bank in an ESCROW CALL ACCOUNT, here before his death.
Last week I contacted the manager of the bank and he told me that the fund is much intact, that I can as well come for it any time I feel like. Please remember that I cannot make use of this fund here due to forces surrounding me at the moment, since I am regarded as a threat to my husband's brothers and they'd threatened to kill me.Please, have mercy at the poor widow like me and help out of this mess. All I want you to do for me is to assist me move this fund from its location now to a foreign land immediately before my late husbands relatives have knowledge of it and claim it just like they did to others. I strongly believe that the only way I can secure this fund is to act fast now and move it overseas, and remember it is only you and I who knows about this and should be treated as such. I need your assistance in the following ways:-
(1) To help me stand as the next beneficiary of the fund and my late husband's foreign business partner.
(2) To make arrangements for me and my two daughters to come over to your country to further their education.
Please note that you stand the chance to benefit from this transaction at the end, which percentage is negotiable. Remember also that my children are the source of my happiness and cannot stand and watch them go through such pains. You will be greatly rewarded and been entitled to a percentage of the proceeds from any investments I may venture into. I look forward to hearing from you soonest, so that we can commence on this, for with God all things are possible.
Best Regards,
Janet Kumah

subject: Re:   Dear Friend
body:
Dear Mrs. Janet Kumah,

Thank you for reaching out to me and sharing your story. I can understand how difficult the situation must be for you and your daughters. It's unfortunate that such traditions and customs exist, causing hardships for women in your community.

I'm interested in learning more about how I can assist you. Could you please provide me with some additional details? Specifically, I would like to know more about the process of moving the funds overseas and what my role would be as your late husband's foreign business partner.

Additionally, it would be helpful to understand the timeline for this endeavor and any potential risks or challenges we might face along the way. Please let me know how we can proceed further.

Best wishes,
Catherine

subject: Re: Dear Friend
body:
Greetings Madam  Catherine

Thank you for your reply. How are you and your business? i hope all is
fine.  Thanks for your acceptance to assist me in this transaction. I urge
you to treat it seriously because I believe that it is only a day that
people meet and become great friends and business partners. It has been my
pleasure to do this transaction with you. I have not told anyone about this
except you and as you being the first person contacted in this transaction.
All I need from you for the execution of this transaction is your maximum
trust, honesty and co-operation for us to get this fund transferred into
your designated bank account. I ASSURE you that you will never face any
risk, this transaction is 100% risk free and legally bidden. now THE FUND
IS deposited with the Standard Chartered Bank by my late husband NAME ,i
have called the bank manager and told him that i have contacted my late
husband business partner which i want the fund to be transfer to his
account and he instructed me to me come to the banking to submit your
details.

I will go to the bank with your information to enable the bank to proceed
with you for the fund. I will also send to you all the documents covering
the transaction and the deposit slip that covers the funds. I have attached
to you my pictures and my husband's family picture for you to know the
person you are dealing with. I don't want to miss this opportunity because
this is the only asset that is in my possession now. I have all the
documents that cover this fund since after the death of my husband only
that I was waiting for a reliable/honest person who will handle this
business so that my husband's relatives will not know of it. I also want to
let you know that I am doing this transaction with you to improve my
standard of living for the future of these kids suffering over nothing. As
soon as this funds is in your possession, me and my family will travel
together to meet you so that we can invest with my own share to enable my
children further their education.What i need from you is your
cooperation/honesty so that we can work towards this and finalize
everything once and for all. My husband was a well known respected man here
and with his personality this transaction will be successful. I am assuring
you that you are not going to regret doing this business with me and I must
keep my word to you . i need your full name and address to contact the bank

Finally, note that this transaction demands maximum cooperation, honesty,
trust and prompt attention for us to achieve our success.I guarantee that
this will be executed under a legitimate arrangement that will protect you
from any breach of the law. God bless you. I will need your details to
submit to the bank. I will update you as soon as I return from the bank.

With best regards,
Best Regards,

MRS. JANET KUMAH.

subject: Re: Dear Friend
body:
Greetings

Please i am still waiting for your details

subject: Re: Dear Friend
body:
Dear Mrs. Janet Kumah,

Thank you for reaching out to me and sharing your situation. I hope you and your family are doing well. I understand that this is a serious matter, and I assure you that I will treat it with the utmost seriousness.

I appreciate your trust in me, and I want to assure you that I will do my best to assist you. However, before we proceed further, could you please provide me with more details about the fund? How much money are we talking about? And what is the nature of your late husband's business?

Additionally, could you explain how the process of transferring the funds to my designated bank account would work? Are there any legal procedures or documentation that need to be completed?

I apologize for asking so many questions, but I believe it's important to have a clear understanding of the situation before moving forward. Once again, thank you for considering me as your business partner.

Best wishes,
Catherine

subject: Re: Dear Friend
body:
Hello! Thank you for reaching out. I'm happy to provide you with any information you need. Could you please let me know what details you are looking for?

Best wishes,
Catherine
